text: - While conservatives and

cheered the current president,
the former US President Barack

Obama was also met with
cheers and applause
on the streets of New York.
[crowd cheering]

The woman who took
the video says

that she heard a commotion
near her job and wanted to go
check it out.

She says after a 30 minute
wait, she was rewarded
with the video you see there.

The 44th president of the US
was walking out of a Starbucks
right there in front of her.

Also in France, some fans
of the former US president

want him to lead
their nation next.

It can't happen, but
a guerrilla campaign

is trying to get a million
signatures on a petition urging
him to run.

The organizer says the
campaign is a joke,

but he wants to show
French politicians
that the people are fed up.

The first round of voting for
the new president of France
is April 23.
